Lorenzo Mingazzi

The Deal with FEM

This website serves as a collection of examples and educational resources centered on the use of the deal.II library for finite element method (FEM) applications.
It is designed for students, researchers, and developers interested in scientific programming with C++, particularly in solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using FEM.

Required Software

  • deal.II library (recommended version: 9.6.0)
  • C++ compiler (e.g., GCC or Clang)
  • CMake for project configuration
  • Text editor or IDE such as Visual Studio Code or CLion

For detailed installation instructions and additional information, please refer to the official deal.II documentation.

Link to deal.II Homepage

For comprehensive information about the deal.II library, including tutorials, documentation, and updates, visit the official website:


https://dealii.org/

Site Sections

  • Introduction: An overview of the deal.II library and its applications.
  • Tutorials: Practical examples demonstrating the use of deal.II in various contexts.
  • Projects: Descriptions of projects developed using deal.II, complete with source code and detailed explanations.
  • Resources: Useful links, additional documentation, and bibliographic references.

Quick access:

  • Initial Examples
  • Fracture Problems
  • Coupled Problems

Site Citation

If you wish to reference this website in your work or projects, please use the following citation:


Lorenzo Mingazzi, "The Deal with FEM", https://lorenzomingazzi.github.io/index.html

Personal Information

My name is Lorenzo Mingazzi, and I have a passion for scientific programming and numerical methods.
Through this website, I aim to share my experiences and knowledge gained from working with the deal.II library.
